intro: Gonzalagunia leptantha, commonly known as the slenderleaf gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
